title: Advisory recommendation based on Profiling
description: In the existing advisory journey i want to create a new onboarding feature which helps me understand the risk appetite of the user and basis that i am able to create a good recommendation baskets which will comprise of both the type of recommendations offered on our App. Also, every recommendation that is given will have a score defined to it which will help us in creating this basket

sources.snippet: Regulation 16 mandates investment advisers to undertake risk profiling of the client and ensure suitability of advice.
The robo-advisory market in India is projected to grow to USD 14 billion in AUM by 2025, driven by low-cost digital onboarding and personalised advice.
BCG estimates India’s wealth-tech TAM at USD 135-150 billion revenue pool by 2030 with 300-350 million retail investors.
smallcase crossed 4 million investors in 2023, mainly through broker partners Zerodha, Upstox, and others.
Upstox Smartlists curates theme-based baskets and displays a suitability indicator based on investor preferences.
Typical digital wealth APIs target <200 ms P95 latency to avoid drop-offs; onboarding compliance (KYC, risk profiling) costs ≈ INR 120–150 per active user.

sections.executive_summary: Risk-scored recommendation baskets can tap India’s fast-growing robo-advisory TAM (USD 14 bn AUM by 2025). Competitors like smallcase, Upstox Smartlists and Zerodha use simplified risk tags but lack dynamic multi-asset scoring. Building a SEBI-compliant risk-profiling engine and basket scorer, with <200 ms advice latency, positions Angel One to upsell advisory and retain users. Key risks are model drift, data privacy (DPDP Act 2023) and suitability breaches. Short-term focus: license alignment, data capture, MVP scorer; long-term: multi-asset optimisation and generative-AI explanations.
sections.market_context: Digital investment advisory in India serves ~40 mn demat account holders, with penetration still <10 % for paid advice. Robo-advisory AUM expected to hit USD 14 bn by 2025 (Livemint). Wealth-tech revenue pool forecast at USD 135-150 bn by 2030 (BCG). Theme-based basket products (smallcase, Smartlists) have seen 4-5× user growth since 2020, indicating adoption of curated portfolios. Barriers: trust, perceived conflict of interest, and low financial literacy outside top-30 cities.
sections.regulatory_flags:
• SEBI Investment Advisers Regulations 2013: mandatory risk profiling & suitability (Reg. 16–17).
• SEBI RA/IA licence fees & net-worth requirements apply if personalised advice is charged.
• DPDP Act 2023: explicit consent for processing personal & financial data; data localisation rules.
• Exchange-mandated investor grievance redressal turnaround ≤30 days.
• Audit of algorithms if classified as ‘execution-only algo’ under SEBI circular Jan 2022.
risks: technical: latency in basket computation, model drift, inaccurate risk scoring due to incomplete data
business: low uptake of paid advisory, cannibalisation of broker revenues, churn if returns lag benchmark
regulatory: SEBI penalties for mis-selling, DPDP data-handling breaches, audit failures of scoring algorithm
opportunities: launch goal-based baskets (tax-saving, retirement) tied to risk scores
offer dynamic re-balancing with push notifications
white-label risk engine to smaller brokers
embed gamified questionnaire to boost completion
use ONDC-like open APIs for third-party research integration
apply Explainable AI to display why a stock fits customer’s risk score
sections.benchmarks:
• API response for personalised advice: <200 ms P95 (PwC 2023).
• Basket re-balancing frequency: industry mean monthly; smallcase offers 1–4 weeks.
• Compliance cost: SEBI IA licence INR 1.5 lakh upfront + INR 10,000 annual; KYC & risk profiling ≈ INR 120–150 per active user.
• Suitability audit cycle: annual (SEBI master circular Oct 2023).
recommendations: SHORT (0-6 m): map advisory flow to SEBI suitability checklist; build 10-question risk tool; launch pilot with equities-only baskets; instrument latency metrics.
MEDIUM (6-18 m): extend scorer to MF/ETF; implement automatic re-balancing; secure ISO 27001 & DPDP readiness certification.
LONG (18 m+): integrate generative AI for conversational portfolio reviews; pursue global expansion to NRI segment via GIFT-IFSC; explore ESG-score overlay.
competitors: Zerodha (smallcase): ~18 % equity retail volume share; strength- seamless execution; weakness- limited personalisation.
Upstox Smartlists: growing tier-2 reach; strength- gamified UI; weakness- lower advisory depth.
Groww (MF risk profiler): user base 45 mn; strength- low-cost MF focus; weakness- lacks multi-asset baskets.
Fyers ‘Thematic Investing’: niche trader community; strength- custom weight edits; weakness- small user base.
Wealthfront (US): global benchmark; strength- automated tax optimisation; weakness- not India-compliant.
